page.title: 15BUILDINGS OF INTEREST 2
page.content: Adjacaent to St.Mary's Church, Salford is the recently restored Georgian Manor House. The only thatched building in the area, a listed building, has been converted from three cottages into a single dwelling. The Old House opposite the derelict Wesleyan Chapel is a successful blend of l7th and 20th century workmanship. The Old School and School House facing the Swan are examples of Victorian architecture featuring a bellcote on the roof. The Old Parish Hall and the Old School have been combined to form the present Village Hall. Old Mill House and the Round House provide a focal point to the village of Hulcote together with the nearby Aspley Hall Farm.
